paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Lab:** Hive External and Managed Tables
**Objective:** Understand the difference between an External table and a Managed Table
**File locations:** 
Local:
~~~console
/tmp/marvel
~~~

HDFS:
~~~console
/data/marvel/marvel-wikia-data.csv
~~~

**Successful outcome:** Understanding the differences between external and managed Hive tables
**Before you begin:**
**Related lessons:** HDFS Data Blocks, Hive Architecture, TEZ

---

msg.data:
About

Lab: Hive External and Managed Tables
Objective: Understand the difference between an External table and a Managed Table
File locations:
Local:

/tmp/marvel

HDFS:

/data/marvel/marvel-wikia-data.csv

Successful outcome: Understanding the differences between external and managed Hive tables
Before you begin:
Related lessons: HDFS Data Blocks, Hive Architecture, TEZ

paragraphs.title: Load the local data into HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash /data/marvel
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -mkdir -p /data/marvel
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -put /tmp/marvel/marvel-wikia-data.csv /data/marvel

msg.data: rm: `/data/marvel': No such file or directory

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### Create Staging Table in Hive External

paragraphs.title: 1 - Show the Hive tables

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
We are going to create a marvel_comics_stage **external** table to store our data.

~~~console
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE marvel_comics_stage ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        ) 
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' 
LOCATION '/warehouse/tablespace/external/hive/marvel_comics_stage/'
~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

msg.data:

                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string

ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' 
LOCATION '/warehouse/tablespace/external/hive/marvel_comics_stage/'

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 2 - Drop table marvel_comics_stage if it exists
3 - Create an external table marvel_comics_stage
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE marvel_comics_stage ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        ) 
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' 
LOCATION '/warehouse/tablespace/external/hive/marvel_comics_stage/'

paragraphs.title: 6 - Load the marvel_comics data into our marvel_comics_stage table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)
LOAD DATA INPATH '/data/marvel/marvel-wikia-data.csv' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE marvel_comics_stage;

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### Create the production table in ORC format

msg.data: Create the production table in ORC format

paragraphs.text:
%md
Now we are going to create a marvel_comics **managed** table to store our data.

~~~console
CREATE TABLE marvel_comics ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        ) 
STORED AS ORC
~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

msg.data:
Now we are going to create a marvel_comics managed table to store our data.

CREATE TABLE marvel_comics ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        ) 
STORED AS ORC

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 10 - Drop managed table marvel_comics if it exists
11 - Create a managed table marvel_comics stored as ORC format
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)
CREATE TABLE marvel_comics ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES int,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string) 
STORED AS ORC;

paragraphs.title: 12 - Using an ITAS statement to insert the data
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)
INSERT INTO TABLE marvel_comics SELECT * from marvel_comics_stage;

paragraphs.title: Delete raw data and Reload the local data into HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh
hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash /warehouse/tablespace/external/hive/marvel_comics_stage

hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash /data/marvel
hdfs dfs -mkdir -p /data/marvel
hdfs dfs -put /tmp/marvel/marvel-wikia-data.csv /data/marvel/

%md

paragraphs.text:
%md
####Important
Note the location for the staging table, we are using /warehouse/tablesapce/external/hive/marvel_comics_stage. 
Hive is the owner of the /wareshouse file system. No others users can write into this file system.

msg.data:
Important

Note the location for the staging table, we are using /warehouse/tablesapce/external/hive/marvel_comics_stage.
Hive is the owner of the /wareshouse file system. No others users can write into this file system.

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
####Important
Insert Table as Select (ITAS) is the most commmon way to load data from an external table to a managed table.
You may also use a Create Table as Select (CTAS)

msg.data:
Important

Insert Table as Select (ITAS) is the most commmon way to load data from an external table to a managed table.
You may also use a Create Table as Select (CTAS)

paragraphs.text:
%md
####Important
When using an External table Hive does not control the data, Hive only controls the schema in the metastore.
This is true if the data for the External table is located in /data/marvel or in /warehouse/tablespace/external/hive. 
Dropping the External table will not delete the HDFS data. It will only delete the schmea in the Hive metastore.

msg.data:
Important

When using an External table Hive does not control the data, Hive only controls the schema in the metastore.
This is true if the data for the External table is located in /data/marvel or in /warehouse/tablespace/external/hive.
Dropping the External table will not delete the HDFS data. It will only delete the schmea in the Hive metastore.
